ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 543
ygData.msgSnippet: I guess I got lucky. When I brought EQ home, my boyfriend didn t seem too interested at first since it wasn t a sport game. But then I left him alone one night
ygData.messageBody:
I guess I got lucky. When I brought EQ home, my boyfriend didn't seem too interested at first since it wasn't a sport game. But then I left him alone one night for about two hours and when I got back, he was hooked. A month later we had to get a 2nd computer and a 2nd acct.

Nadenu Willowmist, Druid of Tholuxe Paells

 Gina Peterson wrote:

> atleast you have a mate to share you addiction with
> I have given up trying to find a mate that does not
> understand EQ
> I only look for a mate that can share my addiction :p
> I look everywhere, far and wide

I'm with you, my friend.  :-)  My ex-husband never understood my love of RP
games to begin with, and that was before EQ came along. Now at the ripe old
age of 35, it's hard to find single men who also like this kind of thing...
so, single I stay, until I meet that man-'o-my-dreams who loves both EQ and
all things Disney.  ;-)

Not holding out much hope,
~Kyndara~
18th Season Ranger in service to Karana
<Unsung Heroes of Antonica>
Firiona Vie
